Chad Bohannan wrote:

> There are common processors, like microcontrolers, that don't have a 
> floating point processor. If you wanted to launch a netork on 
> motorolla's HC08, for example, doing everything in integers would be 
> an enormous speed boost ( rough guess ~80% ).

Thats right Chad. Certainly before the days of dedicated built-in FPUs 
floating point math was painfully slow. But even in todays CPUs with 
highly optimized FPUs I think that integer math executes faster than 
floating point.  Coming up with an integer based activation function 
might be a problem. In the paper I read one way was to use a load 
different lines functions for diferent ranges of X and then a lookup 
table for the sigma curve.

Eliminating the need to call trig functions in the activation function 
is itself another signifiant optimization.

Colin.
